This game is not as hard as half-life 1, but it makes up for that by making the shootouts much cooler than they were in the first game. What made gunfights in the first game fun was the challenge, and in half-life 2 the AI are much smarter and more fun to flank and outsmart. The gravity gun is one of the best parts and all of the different settings and missions feel different. My favorite mission is driving along the coast personally. So yeah, half-life 2 is a fantastic game.

[h1] A masterpiece that ages like wine [/h1]

An absolute and impeccable masterpiece. Half-Life 2 takes all the resources of its prequel and takes it to the next level with a new graphics engine and uniting many game styles into one, offering an unique gameplay.
 
[list]

[*]With this title, Valve has said goodbye to the QUAKE-based GoldSRC graphics engine, and at the same time welcomes probably the most iconic and important graphics engine, the "Source" graphics engine. One of its kind at the time, bringing interactive physics to a large number of objects, improved lighting, and endless remarkable elements, which in addition to this, is very well optimized despite being able to render details such as reflections in the sea ​​very detailed for the time.

[*]Despite being a somewhat old title and, therefore, having old graphics, thanks to the Source engine, a practically perfect atmosphere is achieved, experiencing all kinds of sensations depending on the moment in degree of total immersion.
Something curious about this title, which made me understand the type of title I was getting into, was the fact that, during its introduction, there is a huge amount of detail in the setting, to the point of developing interest in the origin of certain objects, places or situations, coming to make theories during the gameplay.

[*]When I played Half-Life, I thought I was quite satisfied with the story really, it was confusing, but somewhat simple, and I couldn't be more wrong, Valve knew how to exploit the story to the fullest with this sequel, developing a whole universe full of mysteries and action. However, it also manages to maintain part of the classic, it maintained the presence of the silent role and many aspects related to the classic that characterized the first title.

[*]Something I loved about this sequel, and much about the previous one, was the interaction with the characters and their expressions. You could understand what the characters felt, when they fight they worry about the rest (not only at the level of acting, but of feeling) and especially the interaction between the protagonist and Alyx Vance, at first it is quite simple and normal, but approaching in the end, the character manages to express very well how important the protagonist is in the whole story, and at the same time, I really felt those emotions when she wistfully asked me to kick some ass or take care of myself, fighting not to fight, but to fulfill the duty of the protagonist.

[*]The original title mixed the FPS of a lifetime with Puzzles and even with certain occasions with horror FPS, and, as with the case of the story, Valve took this to the next level. At the level of mechanics, Half-Life 2, in addition to an FPS or an Action game, is very difficult to classify, because more than belonging to one, it mixes a huge number of types of gameplay depending on the circumstance, letting the The story defines the gameplay and not the other way around, something that I had never really considered, but it was really applied very well, being able to experience very different and fun situations with each other.

[*]Half-Life 2 complies with the same type of difficulty as its previous title, there are 3 types of difficulty, without the maximum difficulty being really frustrating or really demanding. However, they managed to solve a factor that slightly hindered the gameplay in Half-Life, and that is the absence of automatic save points in strategic points, which caused that, in order to play at maximum difficulty, I had to constantly save on my own. , since if you die, you could lose a lot of your progress, something that did not happen to me in Half-Life 2. There is still the slight use of save points to facilitate gameplay, but it never really helped me.

[*]Something that was used very well was the simplification of the interface, the menu and the adaptation of the title itself for a larger audience, since something that usually happens in gaming is that once you manage to reach a large audience, you must adapt to it in order to resist, which usually leads developers to use practices that are not very favorable to the consumer, however, in the case of Half-Life 2, a large-scale adaptation was not really necessary. They achieved a simple and conservative interface, finally they added the subtitles that I was waiting for so much and the learning curve is very didactic and interactive, so it is not an exclusive title for people with time in this, but it was elaborated in order to be able to attract anyone to this great work.

[/list]

I made the mistake of playing Half-Life 2 with high expectations, so the slightest mistake could change my mind about the title, however, despite all these years, it surprised me like no game had ever done it before, I know that could be overrated from the point of view of some, but I consider this title a masterpiece that has aged like wine.

is a game about a freedman a scientist responsible for releasing the end of the world . With the help of his girlfriend he is able to escape the police and his own personal demons. All the while he has a hard time dealing with his wife who is very different to the woman he married and has to deal with the fact that the love they had for each other was not returned. After he escapes he meets a beautiful woman named Kat who has some trouble trusting him. The game is like an escape from your own life and the game has you doing all the puzzles to get out of your head and back to your daily life. You are not going to see the ending until the credits so be sure you have enough time. If you are looking for a little bit of romance in a sci fi game this is a good choice. Also check out some of our other games like the amazing A.N.T.S. and D.R.E.L. They are all great. We do not recommend playing this game if you do any of these games as the story is not very good and you will get lost. This is the best of both worlds. Play the full version and see for yourself. Thanks for reading. Check out our reviews for other great games.

Eğer az önce jenerik ekranı akarken, arkanıza yaslanıp "Oha" dedirtebiliyorsa bir video oyunu, o oyun muhteşemdir. Eğer bu oyun 20 yıllık ise, işte o zaman karşınızdaki başyapıttır.

2003 yılında mahallemdeki gazete bayinden aldığım dergiler, yanında demo cd ile gelirdi. Orada Half-Life 2'nin, E3 videosunu izleyip beynimden vurulmuşa dönmüştüm. Bugün halen aynı etkiyi üzerimden hissedebiliyorum. Half-Life'ı Half-Life yapan, Source motorudur. Buna bir kez daha ikna oldum. Oyunda tek bir cutscene olmamasına rağmen tüm olay sinematik formatta oyuncuya sunuluyor. Fizikleri o kadar gelişmiş ki, oyunun başından kalkamıyorsunuz, bakın bunu yirmi yıllık oyun yapıyor, bu şaka falan değil.
